summary: This document is a detailed timeline of events surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It chronicles his activities on August 9, 2019, the discovery of him unresponsive on August 10, the medical response, official notifications, and subsequent investigative actions including the removal of computer hard drives from the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual at the center of the timeline who was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019, and later pronounced dead.

persons.name: Reyes Efrain
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who was taken to court on the morning of August 9, 2019, and did not return to the institution, leaving Epstein alone in the cell.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge overseeing Epstein's case who was notified of his death at 10:00 am on August 10, 2019, and later provided with a press release.

connections.description: Reyes Efrain was Epstein's cellmate in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day
events.description: Epstein spends the day in attorney conferences and is reported to be in good spirits during a social call in the evening. His cellmate, Reyes Efrain, departs for court and does not return.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: At 6:33 am, a body alarm is activated in the SHU. Staff find Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR is initiated, EMS is called, and he is transported to Beekman Hospital where he is pronounced dead at 7:36 am.

events.title: Official Notifications and Investigation Launch
events.description: Multiple agencies are notified including the USMS, FBI, AUSA, Judge Berman, and OIG. Epstein's next of kin (brother) is notified. The FBI and OIG arrive at the institution to investigate.

events.title: Removal of SHU Computer Hard Drives
events.description: At 10:15 pm, a Computer Services Manager arrives to remove and replace the hard drives from computers in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: OIG Removes Computers as Evidence
events.description: The Office of the Inspector General (OIG) arrives and departs with two computers (FPS 021407270 and FPS 0214207268) from the institution.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC New York SHU at 6:33 am on Saturday, August 10, 2019, and was pronounced dead at Beekman Hospital at 7:36 am.
Epstein's cellmate, Reyes Efrain, had been taken to court the previous day (August 9) and did not return, leaving Epstein alone in the cell.
On the evening of August 10, 2019, computer hard drives were removed from the SHU and replaced with new ones by a Computer Services Manager.
The timeline documents extensive and rapid notifications to multiple agencies including the FBI, USMS, AUSA, Judge Berman, and the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) following the incident.
The OIG took possession of two specific computers (FPS 021407270 and FPS 0214207268) from the institution on August 11, 2019, as part of their investigation.
